Posted By: Long_Con (2/16/2011 6:31:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A) The Combo works, while it's true you only get to declare attackers once, your not declaring after the first time, the Maze of Ith untaps it and stops damage, it is still attacking period, which allows the Maze to repeat it's effect on the untapped Elder, thus looping infinant mana.
  
   
B) Maze of Ith was an Uncommon in the dark, NOT common. Trust me I've opened boxes of the Dark when I worked for the Comic/gaming store in the 90's.
  
   
Cheers.

posts.post_content: The infinite mana combo works because the creature is not removed from combat. It is still an attacking creature despite being untapped and having all damage dealt to/by it prevented.
posts.html:
The infinite mana combo works because the creature is not removed from combat. It is still an attacking creature despite being untapped and having all damage dealt to/by it prevented.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: CJM2 (7/26/2011 7:41:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Who rated HairlessThoctar's comment down? That combo actually works:
  
   
Declare the Elder as an attacker.
  
Tap the maze to untap him.
  
Tap him to untap the maze and another land.
  
Tap the other land for mana.
  
Tap the maze to untap him.
  
Etc, etc.
  
   
As far as i remember, the mana doesn't stay in the manapool after the combat phase ends, but use an instant spell or a firebreather instead.
posts.html:
Who rated HairlessThoctar's comment down? That combo actually works:

Declare the Elder as an attacker.
Tap the maze to untap him.
Tap him to untap the maze and another land.
Tap the other land for mana.
Tap the maze to untap him.
Etc, etc.

As far as i remember, the mana doesn't stay in the manapool after the combat phase ends, but use an instant spell or a firebreather instead.

posts.post_content:
Dungrove Elder used to be my pick for 'Most Strictly Better Than Predecessor' card ever- vs. Wood Elemental.  
  
Maze of Ith should actually take that place, as it so unbelievably strictly better than Sorrow's Path, is just.....WOW.  
  
These two cards are hilariously similar for being so wildly far apart:   
  
Both from the Dark  
I can't read either of them  
Both of them should be banned to keep new players safe  
-Ban Maze of Ith to keep them safe from their opponent  
-Ban Sorrow's Path to keep them safe from themselves
posts.html:
